author: Michael Goodman

review: I bought the Fire TV stick for use in hotels (as I travel for work) and I wanted to be able to watch my prime and Netflix shows on a bigger screen.  Well, it didn't work because the hotel WiFi changes passwords. So if you want to use it in a hotel, don't bother.  I also had an issue with the way a few of my TVs were set up with the HDMI ports...the angle wouldn't allow the Fire TV stick to go in.  BUT...we found that it will work (and works great) on our 19" TV in the kitchen.  Once I set it up (which was very easy), we were able to use it right away.  My mom, who is technologically retarded, has mastered how to use it...so that is saying something about its ease of use.  She has been able to get caught up on her Downton Abbey program.I highly recommend the product.  The set up is the same as the Fire TV box and is quick and easy.  The only real difference between the two is the remote doesn't have the voice recognition piece, but I rarely use it...and you can type in what you are looking for.  So if you are a Amazon Prime and Netflix (or Hulu Plus) user, I would definitely recommend this product.  Just be sure to check that your HDMI ports have straight on access.  My TVs were curved, so it prevented the stick from going in for the bigger TVs, but no problem with the Fire TV box.  Also, forget about using it on hotel TVs.

review: I was skeptical on the Fire TV for my needs due to the price.  The Fire TV stick sure does deliver at a more than fair price tag.  My only gripe on the newer devices is the lack of Infrared Support.  I believe in this case it's my fault for not staying with the times.The Fire TV Stick is fast and speedy.  You can also restart the device with out unplugging it like other set top boxes that are in this category.  Simply hold the center button and the play button for a few seconds.  An instant restart for optimal performance!
